intro: Haplophyllum corymbulosum, commonly known as the clustered leaf spurge, is a perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of western North America. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. It typically grows in rocky soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its compact growth habit and showy flowers make it a notable species in its native habitat.
